item.description: Learning how to combine operations with the %>% operator.

item.title: dplyr part 3: splitting data frames with group_by()
item.description: Learning how to do the split part of split-apply-combine.

item.title: dplyr part 1: Choosing rows and columns
item.description: Expands on the idea of split-apply-combine and how to use the dplyr package.

item.title: dplyr part 2: Performing calculations on data frames
item.description: Calculating values from data frames: summarise() and mutate(). Calculations using data frames Broadly speaking, there are two kinds of calculations we’d want to perform on data frames, and two functions for doing these: Calculations that return a single answer: summarise() Calculations that return one answer for every row in the data frame: mutate() Before you write code, think: do I want a single answer for my data frame, or do I want a separate answer for each row of the data frame?

item.description: Homework to practice data transformation, exploration, and plotting.

item.description: Intro to the RMarkdown + knitr system for creating reproducible documents.ß
